titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alliance for Progressive Action Records, 1990-2003 AIS.2004.15
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:22:23 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Alliance for Progressive Action (APA) was formed during the spring of 1991 as a coalition of labor and grass roots organizations in Pittsburgh, Pa., that was involved in labor, environmental, social, political and civil rights issues. This collection contains information regarding the organization and activities of the Alliance for Progressive Action.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access to Folder 24 in Box 9 requires a signed confidentiality agreement.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Linda Wambaugh in 1998 and Matt Richards in 2004.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Alliance for Progressive Action (APA) was formed during the spring of 1991 as a coalition of labor and grass roots organizations in Pittsburgh, Pa. APA was involved in labor, environmental, social, political and civil rights issues. The APA became the Pittsburgh chapter of Jobs with Justice, which gave it official status within the AFL-CIO. During the late 1990s into the early 2000s, the organization headed campaigns to create a living wage for workers in Allegheny County, block the privatization of public television in Pittsburgh and create a police review board.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Alliance for Progressive Action Records, 1990-2003, AIS.2004.15, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alliance for Progressive Action Records, 1990-2003, AIS.2004.15, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Zachary Brodt in April 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains information regarding the organization and activities of the Alliance for Progressive Action. Included are extensive documents regarding the Living Wage Campaign in western Pennsylvania, as well as the organization of a citizen's police review board. Clippings regarding the movement to block the privatization of WQEX and fundraising opportunities are also present.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Thomas Merton Center Records, 1971-2004, AIS.1982.19, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System
